content: Write a short paragraph about the life and discoveries of Marie Curie, highlighting her major accomplishments and contributions to science.

Marie Curie was a pioneering physicist and chemist renowned for her groundbreaking work on radioactivity. Born in Poland in 1867, she moved to France to pursue her education and became the first woman to earn a Nobel Prize, which she shared with her husband Pierre Curie and Henri Becquerel in 1903 for their work on radioactivity. She later received a second Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1911 for her discovery of the elements polonium and radium. Curie's work laid the foundation for the field of nuclear physics and had a profound impact on medicine, particularly in the development of X-rays and radiation therapy for cancer treatment. Despite facing significant gender barriers, Curie's dedication and brilliance cemented her legacy as one of the most influential scientists in history.
